Author: Jason Mayden
Post Text: Iâ€™m happy to announce my appointment at the esteemed USC Jimmy Iovine and Andre Young Academy. As a Distinguished visiting lecturer in Product Innovation, I will be leading the creation and execution of academic and developmental experiences that unpack the intersection of cultural disruption and human potential. I seek to expand the definition of what is considered â€œpossibleâ€ for people who have contributed to and shaped the past, present and future expressions of nuanced perspectives aka culture. I started as a kid from the Southside of Chicago, who wanted to design Jordans. Like Nas said, â€œI thought Jordans and a gold chain was living it up.â€ I lived my childhood dream and I have evolved into a person that wants to academically dissect and protect the progenitors of hip hop, sneaker and pop culture. Too often I see outsiders speaking about earth tone creators as if we are another species. Analyzing and deconstructing our existence. This has caused a chasm between those who create the vibes and those who appropriate the vibes. If youâ€™ve been in the industry for a while itâ€™s easy to spot the people whoâ€™ve made a career out of â€œcosplayingâ€ earth tone people and our culture. Our sensibility, creative prowess and unique colloquial dialect is not a trend or a phase. Itâ€™s a zeitgeist that should be studied, revered and protected, vehemently. I plan on doing just that. With that said, all praise due to The Most High for the opportunity to serve, enlighten and inspire the leaders of the near future. Even more grateful to do this alongside my son Khalil C. Mayden who is a second year student at USC IYA. USC, you ready? We are about to get active. ğŸ’ªğŸ¾#FightOn âœŒğŸ¾#WeAreTrillicon

Author: Jason Mayden
Post Text: My first exhibition in 21 years, #BoysBreakToo was a massive success. We had over 300 people visit the gallery over the course of 3 days. So we have decided to extend the exhibition by appointment only, tomorrow until Friday 6/2/23 from 12-4pm. To book a viewing, visit https://lnkd.in/g_PHEYzg Thank you to everyone who prayed for me, helped set up, visited the gallery, shared a post, gave a hug, showed love, made space for others and opened themselves up to hearing honest discussions around mental health. Iâ€™ve overcome PTSD, depression and anxiety. I know how it feels to wake up everyday wondering if there will ever be a silver lining. I created this work during a period of uncertainty and unease. Iâ€™m still in a unique season in my life but I trust and believe in the power of my God given gifts and abilities. My heart and my ideas are in service of the â€œleast of theseâ€. I know God is making a way. So as you watch my journey, just know Iâ€™m living my testimony, right now, in front of the world. And when my bounty comes in, and the blessings flow freely, itâ€™s God and God alone who gets the glory. Iâ€™m doing this for an audience of one. ğŸ™ğŸ¾View and pre-order the entire collection in augmented reality https://lnkd.in/gaE7ZChf #BoysBreakToo now showing at @ShowGallery#WeAreTrillicon ğŸ¥ @kerensouth

Author: Jason Mayden
Post Text: Title: Psalms 56:450x50Mixed Media Print(2023)I was going to write an elaborate post about my forthcoming art exhibition.Instead, I decided to show you one of the seven pieces Iâ€™ve worked on. Everything feels so heavy right now. Black men continue to have to watch versions of ourselves killed by the hands of our own brothers and by the hands of others. We are then asked to â€œperformâ€ without any deterioration in our contribution to work, society and even our own families. Itâ€™s exhausting."Boys Break Too" explores the intersections of race, gender, and mental health through my personal experiences as a Black man navigating these complex issues.I hope this work provides a bit of beauty to your timeline. I hope it provides a sense of healing. I hope it comforts you in your time of need.#WeAreTrillicon#MentalHealthMatters

Author: Jason Mayden
Post Text: Thrilled to join the latest cohort of Henry Crown Fellow at the The Aspen Institute! This opportunity marks a pivotal moment not only in my professional journey but also underscores the critical importance of nurturing creative talent as leaders. The development of such talent is vital for driving innovation and excellence within the design industry. Moreover, it serves as a beacon for quality leadership development, particularly for underserved communities.Being the first in my position to embark on this journey is a profound honor. However, the true essence of this experience transcends individual achievement. Itâ€™s about leveraging this platform to inspire and elevate those around me. Through this fellowship, I am committed to enhancing the landscape of design and leadership opportunities for those who may not have direct access to them. Itâ€™s a chance to mold the future leaders of our industry, ensuring they are equipped with the creativity, empathy, and vision necessary to make a significant impact.The The Aspen Instituteâ€™s dedication to fostering leadership and innovative thinking aligns perfectly with this mission. As a part of the Henry Crown Fellows, I am eager to immerse myself in this enriching environment, where I can both contribute and grow. This experience is not just a personal milestone; itâ€™s a stepping stone towards creating a more inclusive and dynamic industry, where talent from all walks of life can thrive and lead the way towards a brighter, more creative future. Learn more about HCF hereâ€¦http://as.pn/crown2024 #HCF27

Author: Jason Mayden
Post Text: Iâ€™m thankful for life today. So much is going on in the world. People are hurting, society is at odds with itself and the gap between haves and have nots continues to increase. But still, the laughter of my nieces and nephews brings me pure joy. The hugs of my parents and the warm smiles of my siblings give me peace. The beauty and strength of my wife and the grace and maturity of my children give me hope. Regardless of where you are in the world, or what you have going on today, try to find beauty in the moment. The world didnâ€™t give you your joy and the world shouldnâ€™t take it away. If you havenâ€™t heard it today, you are loved. God bless you all. #Thankful#Grateful#GodIsGrand

Author: Jason Mayden
Post Text: #Juneteenth2023 @Lockerverse announcementãƒ»ãƒ»ãƒ»Today, as we celebrate Juneteenth, a day of liberation and resilience, Lockerverse is thrilled to unveil a groundbreaking partnership with designer and TrilliconÂ® CEO, @jasonmayden. In the spirit of this historic day, we bridge the past and the future by introducing digital collectibles from Mayden's critically acclaimed "Boys Break Too" exhibition - an embodiment of strength and identity.Jason Mayden, renowned for his revolutionary work in the footwear industry and as the mastermind behind Super Heroic, skillfully merges creativity, storytelling, and cultural significance in his designs. His "Boys Break Too" exhibition illuminates themes of resilience and self-expression, inspiring young boys to challenge societal expectations and embrace their unique selves.The exclusive digital collectibles provide an insightful exploration of race, gender, and mental health, drawn from Mayden's personal journey as a Black man navigating these complex issues. Each piece stands as a testament to authenticity and the transformative power of self-expression.Mark your calendars! Beginning Monday, July 17, 2023, these exclusive digital collectibles from Jason Mayden's "Boys Break Too" exhibition will be accessible for acquisition on the Lockerverse platform. We invite you to join us in this unparalleled convergence of art, fashion, and technology as we continue to mold the future of the internet.#Lockerverse #JasonMayden #BoysBreakToo #Juneteenth #DigitalCollectibles

Author: Jason Mayden
Post Text: In the intricate dance of culture and style, Michael Jordan and hip-hop move in harmonious synchrony, their stories echoing and amplifying each other's impact on culture. This article delves deep into the intertwined narratives of basketball's greatest icon and hip-hop's transformative influence. From Spike Lee's cinematic genius that immortalized Air Jordans, to the soulful resonance of Mos Def's "Umi Says" in Jordan campaigns, and the trailblazing sneaker collaborations of hip-hop luminaries like Wale, Kanye West, Drake, and Travis Scott, we explore the symphony of design and rhythm. Dive in to discover how the Jordan brand, with its iconic designs, captures the essence of hip-hop's lyrical stories, crafting a legacy that continues to inspire generations. #HipHop50 #WeAreTrillicon

Author: Jason Mayden
Post Text: As the work continues to pick up momentum and interest, we continue to look for sponsors/partners to help tour the Boys Break Too experience. If youâ€™re a global brand or know of a brand that is interested in the conversation of mental health, well-being, fashion, tech and  culture â€” with a specific emphasis on Black & Brown men and boys, then Iâ€™d love to chat. Each experience aka â€œunveilingâ€ is accompanied by a playing of the anthem â€œBoys Break Tooâ€ followed by a lecture where I unpack the nuance of each piece and bring words to difficult topics such as intergenerational trauma and how modern masculinity is deeply connected to productivity/careers as an indicator of our worth in society. Itâ€™s more than an art show. Itâ€™s a conversation intended to catalyze collective healing and amplify the power of community. DMs are open ğŸ™ğŸ¾#WeAreTrillicon

Author: Jason Mayden
Post Text: In today's fast-paced professional world, we often overlook the undeniable connection between physical well-being and workplace performance. I've embarked on a journey with EMS and J'Son's innovative Hero Hacking technique to bridge this gap. Beyond sculpting the body, it's a venture into enhancing mental clarity, resilience, and focus, attributes every professional strives for.As I dive deeper into this transformative process with Master Trainer, Jâ€™son Stamper, I'd love to hear your thoughts. How do you perceive the intersection of fitness and professional success? Have any of you experienced a significant change in your work output after altering your fitness routine? Let's share and grow together. #LinkingFitnessToSuccess #HeroHackingWithJson#WeAreTrillicon

Author: Jason Mayden
Post Text: We are thrilled to announce an inspiring and powerful exhibition, "Boys Break Too," featuring the works of celebrated designer, educator, and entrepreneur Jason Mayden. This one-of-a-kind showcase presents seven original multi-layered prints, digital collectibles, and commemorative merchandise, diving deep into the intersections of race, gender, and mental health through Mayden's personal experiences as a Black man navigating these complex issues.The exhibition aims to ignite conversations surrounding intergenerational trauma and the emotional suppression often faced by Black and Brown men, both young and old, as a means of survival. By showcasing Mayden's thought-provoking works, we seek to encourage constructive dialogue that fosters collective care, celebrates creativity as a form of healing, and raises awareness of valuable resources provided by the National Alliance on Mental Illness (NAMI) Cross-Cultural Innovation and Engagement Hub and the Pensole Lewis College of Business and Design.Supporting the Iron Sharpens Iron Initiative, a portion of the exhibition's sales will be dedicated to providing mental healthcare services for Black and Brown men in need. This groundbreaking program offers participants access to expert mental performance coaching and cutting-edge design courses, cultivating an environment of continuous growth, innovation, and skill development.We are proud to partner with SoLA Contemporary, a nomadic BIPOC, women-led arts nonprofit that serve as a cornerstone for cultural and artistic innovation. Whose goal is to advocate for change by empowering people from diverse backgrounds to take risks in their creative endeavors and explore the intersection of art, wellness, identity, and social change. Additionally, our digital collectible will be made available by Lockerverse, a community platform that integrates core creator tools to enable fans to access communities, merchandise, content, collectibles, and experiences from the creators and brands that define the culture. Our collaboration also includes JUICE, a black-owned startup offering an augmented reality e-commerce platform for unparalleled shopping experiences. Jason Mayden will be the first artist to benefit from this fully immersive customer experience.Join us in celebrating the extraordinary talent of Jason Mayden and engaging in critical conversations on the importance of healing and the transformative power of art. We are honored to present this exhibition and eagerly await your presence at this inspiring event.For more information, please subscribe to the Trillicon Valley Newsletter https://lnkd.in/gvra3qGaFor all press inquiries, please contact  Katy@trilliconvalley.com & Anefertiti@solacontemporary.orgExhibition Dates5/25/23 Private Opening Reception 7pm - 11pm5/26/23 Public Opening 7pm - 11pm5/27/23 Community Programming 12pm - 7pm Location: Show Gallery, 1515 N Gardner Street, Los Angeles, CA 90046

Author: Jason Mayden
Post Text: Fear is a powerful emotion that can either paralyze us or propel us forward. It's a common feeling when we're faced with the unknown or stepping out of our comfort zone. But what if we could harness fear to fuel our growth? In my journey, I've learned that fear can be a powerful motivator, pushing us to achieve our goals and defy the odds. It's not about eliminating fear, but about harnessing it to fuel our growth. So, what fears have you overcome in your career, and how have they shaped your journey? For me, overcoming fear has been about acknowledging it, understanding its roots, and then using it as a catalyst for action. It's about turning fear into a stepping stone rather than a stumbling block. So, the next time you feel fear, acknowledge it, understand it, and then use it as a catalyst for action. #CareerGrowth #OvercomingFear #DefyingOdds"

Author: Jason Mayden
Post Text: We have villianized curiosity in the modern world. If you are not â€œgrindingâ€ you can never be â€œgreatâ€. This obsession with performance has been the Achilles heel of the modern work force. We are literally â€œdying to make a livingâ€ as my brilliant grad school professor Jeffrey Pfeffer so eloquently documented in his book Dying For a Paycheck. When we allow our natural curiosity to lead us we find satisfaction and meaning, not only in our work but in our lives. Iâ€™ve outworked my peers for years and itâ€™s cost me my mental health, physical health and emotional stability. It wasnâ€™t until I ended up in the ER for the umpteenth time in 2019, that I decided to finally remove myself from the fallacy of grind culture. As a result, I have been happier, healthier and more successful. Remember, rest IS a form of reparations âœŠğŸ¾ğŸ–¤

Author: Jason Mayden
Post Text: As creative #leaders, we all know the struggle of finding job security and satisfaction in a tough economy. In times like these, it's more important than ever to have a strong understanding of what we truly value in our careers. This is where Edgar Schein's concept of Career Anchors comes in.Career Anchors are the values and skills we hold most dear and are unwilling to compromise on in our work. By identifying our Career Anchor(s), we can make more intentional career decisions that align with our deeper passions and goals.Let's dive into the eight different Career Anchors, each with its unique values and skills. Perhaps your anchor lies in Technical/Functional Competence, where you pride yourself on your expertise and mastery of skills. Or maybe your anchor is in Creativity, where your artistic expression and innovation drive your work. No matter what your anchor may be, it's important to understand and embrace it fully.And why does identifying your Career Anchor matter? It's simple: job satisfaction. By understanding what truly drives you in your work, you can make intentional career moves that align with your passions and values. You'll find yourself much happier and more fulfilled in your professional life when you're working within your anchors.In these uncertain times, finding our anchor can provide us with the stability and clarity we need to feel grounded and confident in our careers. So take the first step towards finding your own anchor today. Your future self will thank you for it. #creative #work #career #economy #future

Author: Jason Mayden
Post Text: Just had a wonderful conversation with a friend, fellow believer, proud father, husband, and creative Jeremy Utley. Jeremy and I met at the Stanford d.School years ago and we immediately bonded over our shared faith and desire to want to be the leaders that we so often hear don't exist in the world. Kind, compassionate, and fiercely loyal to the greater good. Today's convo comes at a point in my life where I have very real choices to make both personally and professionally. Several unexpected opportunities have been presented to me as the reality of my day-to-day responsibilities looms in the background of my mind. I'm sure many of you can relate. I do not have the answer to which path I will take but I trust that my discernment and more importantly faith will reveal the path forward. If you are reading this, and you feel stuck, overlooked, undervalued, or struggling to make ends meet, I overstand where you are. As an entrepreneur, you have to accept the highs and the lows. The wins and the losses. Truth is, oftentimes, you are losing more than you win. ğŸ¤·ğŸ¾â€â™‚ï¸ But no matter the current circumstance you face, just remember, that consistency is key and victory is inevitable. Keep climbing beloved. You have more people praying for your well-being than there are preying on your vulnerabilities. It's only a matter of time before you reach your destination. #BeConsistent#WeAreTrillicon
